But as it stands there are much better options available at this price point.

Reviews.Title: Okay for My Purposes.  Quality is Lacking.
Reviews.Author: L.Gildart
Reviews.Content: This was incredibly easy to set up, and the only thing I am using it for is to see who is at the front door (I live in an upstairs apartment).  The camera is fairly well-suited to that task, and it seems to stay connected just fine with my iPhone 4, but I'm not actually using it that often or asking that much of it.  The video quality suffices to show me whether it's the UPS driver or a person here to give me a copy of Watchtower.What the camera supposedly *does* but doesn't do well:It's not good for video chatting.  The video quality, while supposedly HD, is considerably worse than the front camera on my iPhone 4, and audio is lousy.Motion sensitive security:  way too sensitive and annoying.Recording video:  Nope.  It's like a strobe sequence in a horror movie.  Just, nope.Bottom line -> this is not a good value in an IP camera.  As of this writing, it is every bit as expensive as the higher quality cameras that are available.  If it were selling for about 1/3 of its current price, I would add a star for value.  At its current price, it gets three stars for mostly serving its purpose.

Reviews.Title: still needs some work
Reviews.Author: Ms. T
Reviews.Content: *Update 6/15* - thanks to a commenter, I did get it to work with ISpy,  by updating the camera list in the wizard (off to the right, for some reason even with the latest software, all the cameras weren't listed), and then I could use the wizard to set it up.  This also showed me the extra info that was necessary to also get it to work with IPCamView - basically http://admin:admin@[camera ip adddress]:80/goform/video.  Basically the admin:admin is the username and password, then @ipaddress of the camera then :80 for the port that it streams thru.  Using this I think you might be able to set it up with any other camera monitoring software or app you choose, altho I haven't been successful configuring it with anything besides ISpy yet.  I gave it an extra star for that to bump it up to a 3 star rating.  The hardware aspect of this camera is great, the optics are good and build quality is about what you'd expect, but it doesn't perform well in low light, and there is no way to adjust the brightness/contrast (I would really like to see belkin add image settings and even an option for auto image setting that could automatically adjust the brightness/contrast based on current lighting conditions).  Also the software for this camera is severely lacking in advanced features - such as saving to an ftp server, setting up motion detection zones, etc..* original * Wow - i saw the other reviews, but thought, surely it can't be that bad.  It is.  The app has virtually no functions and no options.  I thought, well, that's okay, I can use it with IPCamView or even Blue Iris on my computer - BUT NO - it is NOT COMPATIBLE with any other software and apps that almost every other IP camera is compatible with.  WHY?  Why did they choose to limit it like this and render it virtually unusable.  You can't even adjust the image, or set motion detection zones.The app is so basic that you can only log in, and view the camera. If you go into settings you can turn the audio on or off, turn the IR on or off, turn image auto adjust on or off, and set emails on or off and that's pretty much it!  This camera and it's pitiful app mean that it is only good for real time viewing - forget about it if you want to record anything automatically or use it for any kind of home security.  Maybe Belkin will wise up and add some better features in the future, but as it is, this camera is really not good for much other than viewing real time activity.  And because it's not compatible with other software besides Belkin's own, you can't use it to mix and match with other cameras in your home security system.  Trendnet and Foscam both have similar cameras that have all the features this is missing.  IE - the ability to record to SD card or computer when motion is detected, the ability to use it with any software and app that you prefer - and I believe both of them are similar, if not cheaper in price than this Belkin.  I may be trying one of those two for my next WIFI camera.  The logitech alert cameras are more expensive, but also have a much higher feature set than this, as well as really nice desktop software for recording activity and scheduling alerts, etc.Motion detection alerts seem to work okay and it will email you two frames at the time it is triggered, but again, since this is meant for phone/tablet use only, why only email alerts?  There should be an option to have it send push notifications so you can look right away and not have to wait for an email to come thru.  And without it having the capability to automatically record when motion is detected, it is useless unless you happen to be able to drop everything and go into the app and press the record button. If someone breaks into your house - forget it, you cannot have it record them ripping off your stuff so you can give the video to the police.  This makes it basically a glorified nanny cam or pet cam.  And if that's all you want it for, I would get something a lot cheaper than this.Also, at this price point, I feel like it should have an sd card slot to record motion events to, but unfortunately it does not.These Belkin cameras seem to be released prematurely - they advertise easy setup, and sure that is true, it is easy to setup because they are so limited in functionality.  I think they are planning on these cameras as part of a whole home automation system, but right now I would say they are in pre-beta stage and have a lot of work to do - they are starting out with less than other makers have had available for years. I'll be interested to see if they improve functionality of these over time.It does deserve at least one star, because it is so simple to setup that any novice user can do it, and for those that don't want to have to mess with port forwarding, dynamic dns, etc but still want to view their camera from anywhere, then maybe this is the best option and they won't mind all the missing features.

Reviews.Title: Complete #FAIL product
Reviews.Author: IA
Reviews.Content: Love how all the Belkin people have rushed in to thumbs-down my review. Typical.Let's begin. First off all, this is not made by Belkin. It's an off-label brand that they have rebranded as their own. Yet it actually has less functionality than the off-label product.Pros:The video preview quality is decent. That's it.Cons:The software crashes all the time.A 3-second animation plays every time you open the app, even if the app was just idle!The camera keeps losing the connection to the iPhone app, so you need to quit the app and relaunch it constantly.The video recording on the software is limited to about 2 frames per second.The buttons for recording or taking a photo have childish sounds attached to them and they can NOT be turned off. Even if you put your phone on silent.The recording of video stops at random places, probably caused by notifications on your phone.You have to sign up for their service, giving them a username, email and password in order to use the camera. There is NO way around this. This means at any time Belkin can watch your camera!! Now wait a minute, you think this won't ever happen? After I sent 3 emails through the app to Belkin, a notice popped up on the screen of my iPhone stating:Logged out!There has been a log-in of the sameusername and password fromanother computer device.They were looking at my camera!!!!SEE the photo I added above!!I sent it back within 3 hours. You will too.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Brian D. Newby
Reviews.Content: I've been using a Logitech system for a few years at our office and I think I will gradually switch to these over time.  This camera is cheaper and, thus far, more reliable.I liked the ease of setting up and, like the Logitech cameras, I can view things on my iPad.  The difference is that the Logitech records constantly, first to a disk and then to a hard drive on my network.  This one doesn't record, but I can record while viewing the camera, with the video stored to my iPad.At first, the Logitech scenario sounds better, except that I have found it very unreliable.  If I could trade a device that sometimes recorded everything vs. a device that recorded specific things when I wanted it to, I'd choose the latter.  I know that there are times when one is better than the other, but at least with the Belkin, if I check in after an alert and see something of concern, I can immediately record it (and listen if necessary), and know I have it.

Reviews.Title: SKIP IT
Reviews.Author: digitalman "digitalman"
Reviews.Content: There are so many webcams out there. I could never get this one to work. I tried over and over with their iphone app and it never would move past the last stage. I am surprised because belkin typically makes good stuff. All I can say is look else where.

Reviews.Title: Not what I hoped for.
Reviews.Author: Long Island Dad
Reviews.Content: Glitchy connectivity and terribly poor image quality combined with an overly high price make this a poor choice in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Wilson
Reviews.Content: The cameras are great when they work, night vision does not work. I have three of these cameras and can't access them because of useless belkin app, cameras won't work, it logs me off, it says username is wrong even and after hitting login a few times it works. I looked online and others have the exact same problem.Don't buy these because you won't be able to see your cameras a majority of the time and if you goto belkin website, it is difficult to contact them.

Reviews.Title: Was not able to get it to work
Reviews.Author: An Engineer "Happy Shopping!"
Reviews.Content: I am very embarrassed to say I was not able to complete the setup. I was able to connect to the camera with my Android app but the app would lock up during the setup process. Sometimes it would lose connection but after finally completing the setup I went to log in using my new account created in the setup process all I got was a failure to connect.I tired several times and even put it down for a few days then started all over again. I give up, I would return it if I could but since I got it for free now I will pass it to someone else to see if they can get it to work. Maybe the trick is that I am not using an Apple app, maybe the problem is with the Android app. I wish they had some sort of web interface to configure the camera.Happy Shopping!P.S. The camera is very tipsy, the base of the stand is not large enough for the off-center type stand they decided to use.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as Belkin Netcam non-HD
Reviews.Author: John F Fabian
Reviews.Content: I have the Belkin Netcam non-HD which I would give 5 stars for a cam at its price.  However the HD version I found to have an image that appears less sharp, colors washed out and not as good in low light in IR mode.  I played with the settings and got it close to the performance of the non-HD, but this is not what I thought I was buying.  Hopefully a future firmware update might fix this cam, but for now buy the non HD model.

Reviews.Title: Good quality night vision, and CAN be connected like a typical IP camera
Reviews.Author: Heath Buckmaster "_heath_"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE 6/12/13:I have successfully connected this camera to ISPY as an IP Camera. There are numerous posts on the Belkin forums that describe how this works - basically you'll connect to the IP address of your camera like this: http://[ip address]/goform/video. Username/password is: admin/admin. Not very secure, right? ISPY will connect to this style of camera with no issue - just use the Wizard and select Belkin / HD NetCam and you should have no issue. I can't speak to connecting this to things like webcamXP, but it should be a similar process.PRO:Night vision is excellent with this camera. Visibility can be set to day/night or auto and the camera will automatically switch when the light level is too low for normal vision.Responsiveness is quick...movement on the camera is reflected in the mobile app within about 2 seconds, and does not have any significant lag time.Application works on both apple and android products, and is quick and easy to install and use - app is fast and has all the relevant configuration options for the camera plus live view and share.CON:Like other network cameras this one can't be connected to a home surveillance system like a webcamxp or ispy camera device. It creates its own wireless network (which you can't completely customize), and so you must use the Belkin app in order to view the video. This is a huge downside if you already have a home camera solution and just want to add a night-vision camera to it. So if you have a solution, this is a second solution vs. an add-on.Installation is very quick and easy - the camera creates a wireless network that you connect to and configure using the interface, plus the app that you download from either iTunes or Google Play allows for configuration. You can turn audio on/off and quality settings as well.We accidentally left the phone connected to the camera's wi-fi network after config and wondered why we had no internet access - just remember to connect it to your home wi-fi and then move back to your normal setup. You might have to look at the channels of your wi-fi network and move things around so you don't have overlaps, because the camera default isn't configurable as far as I have found. That's another CON for me. I like to fully customize anything on my network, right down to the nitty-gritty.I took two points away for the network inflexibility...otherwise the quality of the camera is very good and in both day and night mode it provides a clear picture with very smooth quality over a mobile connection (4G and wi-fi tested).

Reviews.Title: Great camera, unless set up in a window
Reviews.Author: Crystal Hoffman
Reviews.Content: This is a really great little camera!  Easy set up and easy to use.  My only issue is that it doesn't work at night, if you have it set up to look through a window, because there are red lights that shine OUT of the camera for some reason. So at night time, those lights reflect off the window back into the camera, so that's all I see when I check the camera view.  I can't see my front porch, which is the whole reason I got this camera.  So it's a fine "security camera" during the day, but if you plan on putting it in a window, then it's useless at night time.

Reviews.Title: excelent
Reviews.Author: Wanda L. Vanderlinde "the wonderer"
Reviews.Content: I found this product easy to set up, and has a clear picture.  It also doesn't need a really fast internet connection to operate, I had tried a different brand 1st and it took a very high speed internet to get a useful picture. We plan on using it to monitor the temperature in the house while we are gone on vacation in the winter. So we haven't used it long, the real test will come next winter. But I liked it so much I bought a second one incase Belkin stops making it.  Also the Belkin help center was very helpful when I called with some questions.  Would recommend this unit to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Returning this today
Reviews.Author: Kelly G
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure which camera to get because quite frankly the reviews so mixed for both the Belkin HD with Night Vision and the DropCam Pro.My use for the cameras is to keep an eye on my pets while not at home, as well as the dog-walker to takes care of them while I am out. I set the Belkin up in my kitchen to view anyone coming in the door and the DropCam upstairs to keep an eye on the dogs.First issue with this Belkin. I literally get over FIFTY motion detection emails a day, at that is a low estimage. There is NO ONE in my house and no movement shown on the tiny screenshots sent to my email. Secondly, there is no notification from the app. So if I have the email settings on my phone turned off, I do not get an alert with sound, which considering the number of false alarms, is probably a good thing. Then the email itself, just shows a screenshot of the (non-motion) versus a live feed (more on that in a second). Using the app, to view any clips that may have been taken if there was actual movement requires a subscription to Belink for their cloud service, which I don't think I really need at this point. My last issue is that for some reason the view on my phone shows on the display vertically so I have to turn my phone to view the screen correctly, which is really just an annoyance.Had I not also purchased the DropCam Pro, most of these things might not bother me as much. But with that, the downloaded app alerts me to real movement, so I can actually go into the camera app and view a live feed or any activities that may have recently happened if I missed them (with pretty good sound). You can purchase the cloud also, but I just want to make sure things are good with my dogs here and there, not really storing any data long term. I also get an email with the same thing, but the link through the app is perfect. I don't get any false alarms and the picture/sound I find much better. The only downside to this device, is that you do need a computer/laptop at this point to do the initial set-up, but like the Belkin it was pretty easy.I am not a tech/gadet person and I really wanted to like the less expensive product. However, after using both cameras for a few days, I will be purchasing an additional DropCam and returning the Belkin.

Reviews.Title: Looked Promising, Big Failure
Reviews.Author: BY: Matt Gilmer
Reviews.Content: The short version:Failures:1. Unreliable2. No Cloud Support / Recording / Archiving3. Poor Light Visibility / Contrast4. Does Not Perform To Advertised Specifications5. Poor Support / Troubleshooting6. Multiple Failed Setup Attempts.The Detailed Version:This why the camera fails:1. It only functions properly every other attempt to view it's video stream. Most times, the app and phone require a raw shutdown and fresh restart. (iOS 7 iPhone 5).2. No cloud support whatsoever. You may only record video as you are viewing the camera's stream. This makes the camera virtually useless as a security device.3. When the camera does function, bright areas blind the camera. Simply explained, if the subject of the camera is not evenly lit, you will only be able to view the dim areas. Bright areas will appear as a glare leaving the user unable to view the bright lit area.4. The camera often asks you to reduce its frame rate, so therefore it does function in accordance with its advertised technical specifications.5. Belkin's support page is basically useless. Support articles do not exist even though links for the articles are active.6. Set up took multiple attempts before the camera actually functioned.Pros:The packaging and the camera itself are aesthetically pleasing. Physically, it is a well-designed unit.In conclusion, the camera does not function as advertised and the camera has less features than most of its closely priced competitors.This seems to be the best product for the money. I have ordered three and will update this review accordingly.  ImogenStudio QCP-A200 +Cam Pro Video Security Accessory (White)P. S. I'm an independent consumer who evaluated this product without bias or influence.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't Work As Advertised
Reviews.Author: Do'Glas "MegaConsumer"
Reviews.Content: This is great in concept, but the technology isn't stable.  It's hard to keep a reliable connection, especially on Android operating systems.  The web site crashes frequently.  Customer service couldn't get much worse.  All in all it's a complete failure and I wouldn't be surprised if there was a class action lawsuit to return peoples money.  This thing is a lemon.  What happened to lemon laws designed to protect consumers from crappy products such as this?I forgot to add the night vision camera feature doesn't work at all. Ever.  Not under any circumstances.What a pile of junk!!!

Reviews.Title: slow
Reviews.Author: MB
Reviews.Content: The camera email notifications were so slow they didn't ever take a picture of anything. I timed they at one point and they took about 20-30 seconds between the motion and the photo taken.  Did not like.  Also, have you ever tried to deal with Belkin customer service???  I wouldn't recommend it. Worse than an Islamic beer garden.  I ended up ordering foscam after this and although much tougher to set up.... much happier.  Good luck.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: GmoneyTenn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for two purposes, one for security when away and two to know when my kids get home from school.  The video is pretty good for a lower end camera, and the audio is good too.  I know because it is an internet based camera that there is lag time between the internet and the phone, about 1-2 seconds...not bad for a 100 dollars per camera.  Overall I'm very happy with this camera, it was pretty easy to set up as well.

Reviews.Title: Very easy setup, but limited features
Reviews.Author: Just a guy
Reviews.Content: I have a half dozen different wifi cameras in my house.  This is the easiest to set up.  It has you create an adhoc wifi network with you iphone, then it simply attaches itself to your wifi network.  It all runs through an iphone app.  The antenna is internal, so not very good.The camera gives a decent picture - looks pretty HD to me.  Colors are accurately reproduced.The app is not optimized for the iphone 5, so it clips the top and bottom. There is no dedicated ipad app, so only a tiny window iphone emulation.I cannot figure out how to access the camera using other software - I can only get it to work through the Belkin app.The app itself is pretty bare bones. There are no brightness controls.  There is no portrait orientation (only landscape).  You cant even pinch to zoom.  Audio streaming is patchy at best - maybe due to a weak signal. When recording video, the frame rate drops to an unusable level.The app allows you to do motion detection, but that is completely useless.  Even at the least sensative setting it detects every minor movement of a cloud changing the lighting in the room a tiny bit.  And the emails it sends you are all have the incorrect time in the subject - unless you happen to be in CA, which the camera knows I am not.This does not work well for monitoring anything because the internet feed (outside the same wifi network) times out after 5 min.  This cannot be changed and has been confirmed with Belkin.I give this three stars.  It has potential to be four or even five if the software were improved.The setup was very easy, so that is a major plus.

Reviews.Title: Not the best image quality
Reviews.Author: M. Fiori "A Concerned Parent"
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and been very reliable so far. The image quality is not that great though you lose a lot of detail in anything that is more than about six feet from the camera. Works at night but again, very low quality black and white image at night. Motion detection works well at night.

Reviews.Title: not sure why this product is so panned
Reviews.Author: Joselito Q. Tongson
Reviews.Content: My other cameras:I have an outdoor Foscam camera whose WIFI never worked out of the box, so I don't currently use it, it needs to be connected via Ethernet;max resolution 640 by 480.  I also have (8) WVC80N Linksys cameras which are no longer supported by Cisco and whose email option stopped working after a few years. If you google the camera you can read about the problem. The Linksys cameras require you forward ports on your router which I learned how to do, max resolution is 640 by 480.  I also have (4) Uniden Guardian G455 system outdoor cameras.  They are mounted and used outdoors.  I like them but the max resolution is only 320 by 240.  Each camera has it's pros and cons.  It just depends upon what you need your IP camera to do, figure out what's most important to you.  You also need to assess your ability to configure and use the camera on your system.  I use a MAC, Airport Extreme, Iphone and Ipad.Review:In a related issue,  I've been integrating the WEMO switch and motion products at my home to control lights and to monitor our dog walker.  I stayed from this camera because of the reviews here and other places but when I read that the Netcam product was also integrated with the WEMO line I decided to buy one today and test it out.I had everything up and running in 5 minutes including iphone access.  I have no idea why this is getting so many 1 star ratings.  Maybe Belkin has made changes for the better.  I'm getting email alerts and alerts in the WEMO iphone app.I really love the resolution.  Is the night vision a little lacking, yes.  But this is a very inexpensive camera, and I'm using it indoors and the night vision is good enough.  You certainly can buy more expensive products if you need a "professional" or "commercial" product.The only downside is the Belkin Netcloud service which is needed to get the email alerts.  It comes with a free 30 day trial and I can't find pricing after the trial period.  But, the WEMO app alerts me of any motion detection so I really don't need the additional emails filling up my inbox.  So we will see in 30 days if I have to pay to keep videos stored in the cloud.  I would like these to replace my Linksys WVC80N cameras one day.Using the iPhone app, you can access the saved video clips  It will also save snap shots and video directly to your iPhone album. I feel like I'm rambling but I really like this camera and am glad I bought it.  Hopefully, Belkin will keep supporting this camera.  I'm a big fan of the WEMO line of products and that is a major advantage of this IP camera.For the out doors, I will use the Uniden cameras.  For inside, the Netcam and Linksys.Hope this helps someoneUpdate Feb 22:Yesterday at work, I must have accessed the camera 10-15 times just to test the Belkin cloud service.  The camera connected every time without fail.  This is the first camera whose soiund has worked flawlessly.  The Linksys cameras sound doesn't work with Mac or Iphone.  This has been a nice addition to my home security and monitoring system.Update Feb 27th:So still happy with my purchase, in fact I bought another one.  I also posted on Belkin's facebook page about allowing you to schedule the motion detection separate from the save video clip feature.  The dropcam HD has this feature without their cloud services. Also, a picture of the last view would  be nice. IMHO, the dropcam HD and Belkin are very similar.  Dropcamm has spent more time refining their app but the Belkin camera is much less expensive.  I do like the dropcam formfactor but the belkin is also nice, not as small but it's nice.

Reviews.Title: Belkin Netcams work perfectly.
Reviews.Author: K. Senseny
Reviews.Content: I have read several negative reviews of the Belkin NetCam that are critical of its performance and functions.  I have three of these cameras in operation and they work absolutely flawlessly. They do exactly what they were designed to do. They give me remote viewing of the cameras from my PC or iPad instantly whenever I want to view the cameras.  I have one of them set up to notify me by email when there is motion (and once I set the sensitivity for the motion) it works fine. They even have infrared vision for night viewing which works well when there is some limited light available.  This camera is designed to allow quick camera setup without the need for a PC. It took me about 15 minutes from opening the box to having it in full operation. Everyone I have shown the iPad app to, cannot believe how clear the video signal is and are impressed when I show them emails with pictures that are sent to me whenever there is movement in the camera view.  These cameras do exactly what I purchased them to do.  Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for spying on your home, but not so much for security.
Reviews.Author: Hondabox "Hondabox"
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Quality is excellent when you are viewing on your local network.Very good quality when streaming outside of your network.Quality is acceptable viewing from your cell data.Easy to set up if you use the app on your iphone/ipad.Night vision is very good to about 25' as long as it is not pointed through a window.Cons:  Motion detection options are very limited.  Lacks ability to specify an area to detect.Disappointed that all notifications are through Belkin and they can only send you two snapshots of the motion being detected.Notifications are very delayed coming from Belkin.NO option to record motion video.  You have to log into your camera and physically hit the record button.

Reviews.Title: Decent - depends on how you want to use it
Reviews.Author: gkhunt
Reviews.Content: The camera is good for the price and what I needed. The lens is good and it was very easy to set up. The online interface is easy to access from your phone or from a computer. The interface doesn't always work and isn't very intuitive. I also set up the motion sensor which emails me when their is motion in my house. I like that feature but I wish this was easier to turn on and off as I get frequent emails when I am home which is annoying. I use it as a relatively passive security/monitoring tool and it is good for that.

Reviews.Title: Disastrous software sinks this otherwise fine product
Reviews.Author: Dr. Goetz K. Oertel "Goetz von Berlichingen"
Reviews.Content: The product is neat, clean, well designed - it looks as if it was made by a top quality manufacturer.  Trouble started for me when I tried to follow the accompanying instructions (which, by the way, were among the clearest and best prepared instructions I have seen with any product in some time.)  Already one of the first steps failed:  download the Belkin camera app on your mobile device.  First, I tried my one year old Ipad.  The App store advised:  no app for Belkin camera available.  OK, so I tried on my 4 year old Ipad - one of the originals.  It found the Belkin camera App - hurrah.  The cheers did not last long as it required me to sign in to my Belkin account.  My Belkin account?? I had never heard of Belkin before, certainly had no account with them.  Not ready to give up, I found the Belkin site with Safari on my MacBook Pro.  After a little hunting around, I found a place that offered opening an account for free.  Success at last?  Not for long.  The Ipad Belkin App "failed to recognize username or password".  So, I changed the password and tried again:  Same result.  I gave up for day one.  On day 2, I changed the password and username a few times, went in and out of this and that Belkin web site on this and that Ipad and MacBook Pro, but the Belkin camera app simply would not load on my Ipad - which seemed to have gathered my username and password in some other, strange universe - so a password entered with MacBook Pro would not work on any of the Ipads.  Most annoyingly:  all this occurred within the first few lines of the Belkin camera instructions - which said only to download the app on the mobile device but said absolutely nothing about an account with Belkin or about usernames or passwords or how they worked only on one type of device and not on another.  The instructions also boldly proclaimed that one needed no computer - only the mobile device to activate the uit.  Rubbish!!  So, sadly, the very nice unit went back in the box and is now on its way back to Amazon - which, thank God, takes stuff back and gives full credit for it.  Wish someone had tried to actually use one before marketing it!  Certainly, Belkin's name is dirt around my place.

Reviews.Title: Camera SUCKS!!!
Reviews.Author: 0mie
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of these, one for the living room & one for a baby monitor. The quality was below subpar, I would get ~7FPS and couldn't see anything. It stuttered like crazy, the camera was a few feet from my router. I wouldn't recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Won't connect to android phone
Reviews.Author: RACampbell "MUSIClassical"
Reviews.Content: Spent the afternoon trying to hook this camera up to the phone but would not sync with Internet WiFi I briefly saw an image it had captured but unable to get new image to appear on the app. I'm a 75 year old male with above average intellect. Will give it to a child for Christmas. They will no doubt have no problem setting it up.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup
Reviews.Author: Michael Sanchez
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to setup right out of the box. There were a few things to learn and get used to about the iphone app. Once you use it for a while it's great. If you have another user who wants to view the camera it logs you out of the app. I found that viewing is also available through a browser. Setting up the position is easy because you only have to worry about a power source. Not sure if it helps but I realized I also have a belkin N600 Router for the camera, but it works with any wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup HD has very poor definition
Reviews.Author: Richard A Carlson
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to set up and you have ability to snap a picture into your camera role. A major plus for the camera.The definition is not great quality. At 20 feet from camera a face is nor recognizable.,At night you need a lot of light for the camera to work in color mode. I has three lights as well as a HD TV on in a 15X22ft room and it was in black & white mode.All in all it is a good product if you just want to view an area such as confirming an intruder when an alarm goes off.It is also good for viewing activity such as a nanny, maid or the children..I purchased a second camera that is not HD. When it arrivesI will report on it..The App. Works well in both WiFi & 4G mode. Log in is very fast in both modes.For the price, quality of the device and ease of setup as well as tech support which I rate a 10 I recommend this camera..

Reviews.Title: great baby monitor
Reviews.Author: JMiller
Reviews.Content: We just got this as a gift for our baby.  Easy set up and both my wife and I can quickly check in on the baby.  I love being able to check on him while I'm at work and he is napping.  I agree audio is patchy but compared to tradational baby monitors it is just fine.  The night vision is fantastic.  I just ordered another camera to set up in the basement so I can check in on the other kids when I hear some fighting.  Dont get me wrong...I watch my kids all the time this is not a babysitter.  But it allows my wife and I to see whats going on so much easier.  I would not reccomend for home servalance but as a live monitor it is pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed...
Reviews.Author: Rojojovi
Reviews.Content: I could not access using my Android phone; I needed to use an Iphone.  Once set up, it ran slow.  I made adjustments to the settings, then it wouldn't work at all.  I also noticed, it runs VERY hot to the touch.  Definitely on my return list...

Reviews.Title: poor performance
Reviews.Author: Chaim Zorger
Reviews.Content: This so called HD Camara has horrific performance, audio gets cut off, quality is poor, app is horrible need to log in when exiting the app for a second, video freezes, not possible to log in from 2 devices at once.

Reviews.Title: cam no longer works with current APP as of June 2013-
Reviews.Author: Jack McCormack "Sport"
Reviews.Content: >>>> Disregard any positive reviews- they're outdated -cam no longer works with current APP as of June 2013-Disregard all positive reviews prior to  June 2013- >>>>> 1) Updated App makes it so the cam no longer works with a smartphone!>>>>> I bought one, tried it out, no problems, easy to set up, so I bought 3 more. THEN they upgraded the app, and it no longer works... so you can no longer use your phone to se the cams if on 3g or 4g network, only if it is on wifi. As stated- it was working until they changed the app... but now 'm out of warranty on 4 netcams and can no longer return them..>>>> 2) Customer Service is non responsive, and not useful if you can get through, which you will be frustrated by.forget their customer service... I have been dealing with them for a month now...even if you get an English speaking person, they are pretty useless, but VERY GOOD at asking you to spell out your name and email address each time, trying to get you to do the same stuf you alrady tried, re-booting, re-initializing, etc with the same result.  FINALLY i received an email from a level 2 tech person with his phone number- I have called this number 10 times in as many days, leaving the same long message with my reference number, name, phone number etc and surprise surprise, no call back!3) BOTTOM LINE- DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY unless you like being frustrated...then this product is for you!

Reviews.Title: faild to work, no tech support
Reviews.Author: funbear
Reviews.Content: I always had high regard for Belkin products, till I bought this cam.  Followed the simple instructions, hit immediate snag.  App freezes up, pc can't see cam... there is 800# in the product, you call, and it connects you to some bizzare chat or porn group, either wrong number printed, or they shut down tech support.  Go to Belkin web site, no support number, no support help.  My guess is, they entered the IP cam business and jumped out.  Stick to Foscam, while they are quirky, their support will get the product working...and the Foscams are more versatile, they pan, tilt and all the remote apps work.

Reviews.Title: Netcam does not work!
Reviews.Author: frustrated with Netcam
Reviews.Content: Couldn't get Netcam app to access network.  Router tech support said app needs a certain router port to work.  If I have the port number, no problem.  Called Belkin.  Told I have to purchase "premium" tech support for this product.  What?  This product out of the box does not work, and I have to purchase tech support?. . . just to get a port number?  Really?Bottom line, if the Netcam HD app can access your home network, great.  If not, don't spend hours on the internet scouring tech sites for the port number that the Netcam app uses.  Trust me it's not out there.  And don't bother calling Belkin Tech Support in India, they will just tell you that they can't help you unless you pay for "premium" tech support.  Don't even bother, just take the camera back for a refund like I'm doing on Monday.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Chi Ginger
Reviews.Content: Our family uses this as a pet monitor .  The best part is that you can talk through your smartphone to whoever/whatever is in the room.  So if they're not near the camera, we call their names, they appear and all is good.For this price range and ease of use we bought another one.  Well done Belkin!  The ONLY thing I have to complain about is the camera and plug get super hot.  Hopefully they can improve on that.

Reviews.Title: DAMAGED!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Garrett Fowler
Reviews.Content: BOUGHT 2 CAMERA'S AT SAME TIME!  OPENED THE PACKAGE AND ONE CAMERA WAS NOT EVEN WHAT I ORDERED AND THE OTHER WAS...THEY BOTH WERE LOOSE AND ROLLING AROUND IN THE BOXES.  SENT THE WRONG ONE BACK AND TRIED TO USE THE OTHER ONE AND IT ENDED UP NOT WORKING PROPERLY.  VERY DISAPPOINTED!

Reviews.Title: Not perfect, but good for the money.
Reviews.Author: OmahaStudent
Reviews.Content: I have read many of these reviews and I feel that they are being a little too critical of this camera. I'm not quite sure what they expect from a $100 WiFi camera, but I feel that this has at least met many of my expectations at $100 less than a Dropcam. That being said, there is some merit to at least some of what they have been saying.Pros vs. Cons1) The recording frame rate as reported by some people is pretty low, about 2 FPS. I feel that this is more of a software issue than anything else, because the camera streams at a much higher frame rate. By no means is the picture flawless, but there are so many factors that go into image quality when streaming over the web, let alone multiple wireless devices.2) Set up is really pretty easy, I feel like those that have had issues with them either are technically challenged, blowing things out of proportion, or have other defective equipment that is not the fault of this device or Belkin. It really only took me about 4-5 minutes from start to finish, including downloading the app. If you can download an app and connect to a WiFi network, then you should be able to figure this out.3) It has a feature that is completely unadvertised as far as I can tell. It does have the ability to have 2-way communication. There is a feature on the app that allows you to speak to someone in the same room as the camera. I haven't messed with this a ton, but it seems like a useful way to try and calm pets down remotely, etc.4) Night vision picture quality really does seem pretty good. In a relatively dark room I could easily make out everything.5) The app does leave some to be desired, but it is functional. I really wish that they would add some features that I have seen from other cameras. The biggest things that it is lacking is a push notification directly to your device if motion is detected. All that it currently does is send an email with a picture of the action. The second shortfall in this department is it will send notification after notification for undesired motion. We leave the TV on for our dogs to drown out the noise of the apartment complex. The camera detects this as motion and sends alerts all day long. This would be easily solved by allowing the user to block a portion of the field of vision from motion detection. Also, it really needs a time feature where you can allow it to ignore motion when you would typically be home, again avoiding unwanted notifications.6) Belkin currently lacks any outdoor capable cameras, not a deal breaker for many, but would definitely be popular in my opinion.All in all I would buy another one of these, and really probably plan on it.

Reviews.Title: Amazon should NOT sell this product - it wll not work with all Android devices - NO APP for Kindle Fire HD.
Reviews.Author: CarNut
Reviews.Content: Save you money. It will not work with Kindle Fire HD.You buy it, it says it works on all And20 minutes listening to cheesy musac on Belkin's help (hah!) line and they come back with "It works on all Kindle Fires" - Does that include Kindle Fire HD?"Oh, no, that's not a real Kindle."Yeah, right. Bye bye.

Reviews.Title: Does not function properly
Reviews.Author: Thomas J. Tucker, Jr.
Reviews.Content: Android app does not work even with the latest firmware.  Cannot turn email notifications off or on from the app.  Have worked with tech support with no fix.  Now with the engineering team but no fix yet.  Camera also keeps sending false motion alert emails even when camera is set to the lowest motion setting.  Would not purchase again.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Wei Wu
Reviews.Content: I bought two of the cameras recently and was reasonably happy with the quality. The set up process is really easy, took me less than 5 minutes each. There are dedicated app for the camera but once set up on the wifi network, the Wemo (I have a few Wemo switches) app displays the cameras as well. The vedio quality is in line with my expectations, given the purpose of the camera, the vedio quality can't be too high otherwise the mobile network won't be able to deliver .Overall, I'm quite happy with the quality and the app so far. I haven't started to try the cloud service yet so can't comment

Reviews.Title: Added security
Reviews.Author: anna
Reviews.Content: I thought I would try these because of the motion sensor and the smartphone and computer alerts, and they are worth every penny. they or so easy to install.  I totally love them!

Reviews.Title: Sensitive to light
Reviews.Author: Crys
Reviews.Content: I love the camera but it is to sensitive to the light coming through my patio doors so it sends emails alerts every other minute. I turned the email alerts to off but that no good because that the purpose to get an email alert when there is movement. Help

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Shortie
Reviews.Content: This camera works very well with adequate lighting, not so well in low light. The sound is great, all together it meets my needs.

Reviews.Title: They do the job
Reviews.Author: Gary Little
Reviews.Content: I have 5 of these camera's. They work very good for the price. I really enjoy see what is going on at my Florida home and my business and residents in NY.

Reviews.Title: Loved it
Reviews.Author: hat442@hotmail.com
Reviews.Content: Crystal clear & easy to use. This is not my first Belkin, it never failed it surprise me with its quality images. I definitely recommend it �

Reviews.Title: Higher resolution but lower low light sensitivity
Reviews.Author: O.E. Frik
Reviews.Content: Compared to the lower resolution version (630x480), this camera is less sensitive to low light. The Auto IR comes on too early so the camera switches to the B&W; mode while there is still enough ambient light.

Reviews.Title: Wi-Fi cameras HD
Reviews.Author: Mad dog
Reviews.Content: For the money I think they're great little camera they and the Wi-Fi part of them goes really far over 200 feet the camera part is good up to 10 foot away very easy to hook up

Reviews.Title: Belkin HD WIFI Camera
Reviews.Author: william deutsch
Reviews.Content: I wanted a simple system so I could observe the one entry door to my apartment when I'm half-way around the world.  This product was the only one available on short notice so I took a chance.The good:  Software easy to download and navigate.  Camera easy to use, just plug into outlet and point in direction you want to observe.  Settings allow for motion detection for small objects up to larger objects.  Night vision/day vision color camera.Basically, the system works.  I set it up in my apartment, downloaded the Belkin app from the iPhone app store and that was it.  I'm literally half-way around the world and motion detected in my apartment triggers a photo (2) to be taken, and I get an email stating motion was detected.  I open the mail and in a few seconds 2 pictures appear.  I can enlarge the pictures with my fingers,copy to photos, begin a video clip etc.  So essentially if someone enters my apartment I will be notified, can see who it was and can take action if needed.  Plus, anytime I want to see my apartment I simply open the app and there's my entry door. Night vision is adequate to see if door is open but I doubt I could recognize anyone entering at night.  But it's enough to notify me of an event occurring.  The software, one month after installation and activation is flawless.The bad:  Camera comes only in white.  Black is easier to conceal among books, furniture etc.  Quality of HD camera is not very good and the lens should be wider angle.  Even from only 15 feet away, it's difficult to clearly see a photo for facial recognition.  The motion detection is very sensitive.  Some mornings I wake up to find 30 emails acknowledging activation.  For the dollars paid the device does give me some piece of mind that at anytime I can see my apartment.  But lack of color choice of camera, poor quality of picture should give one pause.  Also, to preserve photo or video requires activation of iCloud option offered by Belkin.  If camera quality were first rate, I would consider this.  But what's the point of preserving poor image quality for posterity?

Reviews.Title: Good fit for me.
Reviews.Author: Robert Berger
Reviews.Content: I like the email alert. Live video feed works great for my phone. The only down fall is the infrared does not work well through window. Had some difficulties setting up at first. Great for when we go on vacation.

Reviews.Title: A good camera
Reviews.Author: Alexander Sokolov
Reviews.Content: Easy to setup. I do not understand feedbacks which mention a difficult setup. That's not true. Night vision may be not very clear comparing with other products, but for me it's ok - this camera does all that it was made for.

Reviews.Title: You will be happier with this camera over all others
Reviews.Author: jlarsen
Reviews.Content: I have tried other cameras.  I returned them, and RE-bought these.  Yes, I sent these back, bought the dropcam.  It was 50.00 more per cam, and it had the same performance.  I returned these because of the lag time.  But, after trying other wifi cams, this was my first choice.I did have problems with the NON-HD, so don't get that one!  The picture is better quality with the HD, and the HD model seems to show a smoother, and less lag time.

Reviews.Title: Directions are terrible
Reviews.Author: Robert Lawhorne
Reviews.Content: The directions are almost non-existant!!  They do not explain how to go online to be able to access the camera, only from your cell phone.  Thankfully a friend of mine owns the same camera and he had to call Belkin to find out how to set it up. he explained it to me and gave me the website.  [...]Then set up an account from there.  For the money they are quite good. There is a delay when the picture is taken and when watching live.I have not installed them outside yet (under eve of house) and have worked okay indoors.. Will have to wait and see how they do in the elements,

Reviews.Title: Best IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Great camera easy to setup and easy to use. The best part is there is no fee for checking it on Internet.

Reviews.Title: Glitchy
Reviews.Author: witcheye
Reviews.Content: The Camera can be glitchy and can go days not connected to wifi.  Often Long connect times to view camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice setup.  No alerts.  Lousy support.
Reviews.Author: Jacquelyn Barney
Reviews.Content: Set up was really easy.  Unfortunately, I couldn't get the motion detection alerts to work.  Tried resetting the camera.  Went through all the doc on the website.  Tried calling tech support, but could never get through.  Pretty unimpressed.  Don't waste your time and money on this product.  I am taking mine back.

Reviews.Title: Video is good, Belkin App for windows and smart phone not reliable
Reviews.Author: Skyking
Reviews.Content: Video has good resolution. The Belkin App for Windows and smart phone is unreliable. It is often out of service. Recently I could not access the cameras on line for over 24 hours. I was never able to access the audio feature. I have two of them.

Reviews.Title: Has potential...
Reviews.Author: DJ CURTIZ
Reviews.Content: This device has potential but the system supporting the video/audio relay is a bit of a dissapointment. Once you move away from your router speeds rapidly drop and you find yourself setting the quality settings so low just to get a decent picture+frame rate+quality combo. Audio seems to fair well when the video is on the lower settings however the auto-detect motion feature needs an even lower setting as I get way to many motion trigger emails even at the lowest setting. If this cameras hardware supported 5GHZ networks I believe most of the video issues would be solved. I understand that 5GHZ limits the distance away from the access point but I think for most end users this would be a welcomed upgrade. Perhaps the relay/p2p servers on Belkin's end could be upgraded as well to help ease the load placed on the end user's device and network. Night vision works fairly well and I feel is the strongest feature on this device.The app supporting this device on iOS works great and is very solid. I have no problem connecting to my cam via 3G/4G/LTE without having to adjust my router with port forwarding etc which is great news for novices looking to add cheap video security to their home/business.All in all it all comes down to how far away this device will sit from your router. 2-3 rooms away on the same floor you should have no problems but once you move further away or up/down a flight of stairs, you will immediately notice a drop in video speed/quality which would happen with any wireless video device really. I have used many wireless/wired video solutions and believe this particular device to be decent quality for the $$$ with an added bonus of a seamless and simple setup that anyone who uses a smartphone should be able to do.

Reviews.Title: Belkin Software on HD Wireless works well.
Reviews.Author: Randall J.
Reviews.Content: The software works well from an Apple product, Ipad , IPhone and the like.Sure like to see a browser based adaptation for Windows and OS-X.

Reviews.Title: Probably a decent product, did not serve the purpose I bought it for
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money if you need to use this portably, as this device has to be connected to a power source at all times. Great invention, but needs to be updated to support a LiON battery because not everything that needs to be surveilled has an accessible power source. The moment I found this out, it went right back in the box and was returned.

Reviews.Title: A good and easy camera to set-up.
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Dee
Reviews.Content: This security camera is so easy to set-up. Just flick the switch at back downwards and  load the IOS or Android app. Settings are all done via wi-fi. No need to plug the camera to the router. No need to tinker with the router settings. Only 3 things prevented me from giving the camera a 5 stars- anyone can tinker with the set-up switch located at the back, you need to go to the belkin website to turn on/off motion sensor, and need for better picture quality.  Otherwise, I am pretty satisfied with the netcam's performance.

Reviews.Title: I'm sticking with Foscam for now - prefer using with the VeraLite
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "formerly a Road Warrior of t...
Reviews.Content: I just couldn't get this Belkin to be recognized on our Veralite.  An IP camera should be interchangeable but as of this time it is not usable that I've been able to find...This Belkin Netcam HD would be great for someone who only wants a single camera, no pan or tilt, and doesn't ever intend to upgrade their system with multiple cameras in multiple applications.  Say maybe to keep an eye on a porch to see if a package was delivered or not... but I would only use this camera in a protected environment, such as under an awning.

Reviews.Title: Works Well But...
Reviews.Author: Howard Ignatius "HJI"
Reviews.Content: Had issues with the light deciding on whether it was day or night. However, it did produce an image on almost any connection we had in Europe.

Reviews.Title: Very simple to setup! Provides just the basics in functionality.
Reviews.Author: C. Weaver
Reviews.Content: The Belkin NetCam HD wireless IP camera is fantastically easy to setup and configure, once you figure out the "star" on the back is a Gear=Setup :)Within a couple minutes you can have the camera up and running with the ability to view locally over your WiFi network as well as remotely over the web via their cloud access site http://netcam.belkin.com You can even easily share the video with others without giving them your own password or the ability to change your configuration.The camera itself is approximately 4" tall and 2.5" wide and while most of the camera is 5/8" thick from the extended power port to the extended lens it is a full 1" thick. The base raises it 1" in table top mode or if wall mounted the camera extends 5" from the wall.On the front of the camera is a small aperture lens surrounded by IR LED lamps for night vision and a small slot for the built in microphone.On the back is a single switch for setup or live view mode as well as three lights to identify the status setup/wifi connected/power.The video quality is ok, certainly not HD by television standards, but good enough to get a good view of what is going on in the room as well as identify people. Audio quality on the other hand is not good. The audio crackles and pops so you won't want to use it to monitor a quiet room as you will be listening to a lot of noise. If you need to hear what is going on the microphone does a good job picking up sounds and voices and they are pretty clear over the background transmission noise.Switching to night mode is silent, unlike some other cameras that click to switch in a filter. While the filter may improve night vision on those cameras having a silent switchover is a welcome feature when living with the camera. However the night mode is not stealth. The camera emits a slight red glow from the IR LEDs that is uses to light up the room which work for about 15'. In night mode the image quality does suffer but it is very useable. Don't expect to be able to identify strangers though.The iOS Belkin NetCam app is no frills. No rotation, not even upside down, iphone only you must zoom to use on an iPad. You can access basic setup, turn on sound, take snapshots, and setup email notification which is not especially useful as there is no ability to set a schedule. While sharing is listed in the app you must visit the website to configure this. And you have to do that from a PC, even though the app will launch the website in Safari, the developers at Belkin decided to require Flash to access their website which won't work on your iOS device.I recommend this camera as a buy for watching kids, pets, or the elderly unless you want to leave the audio running all the time. The app and website easily support multiple cameras and multiple accounts being able to view the video. But for security it is a don't buy. The email alerts are limited and recording video just isn't there in any useful way.

Reviews.Title: No Tilt or Pan, Otherwise an OK IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Doffod "Bookworm"
Reviews.Content: I have installed more than a dozen or so IP cameras at my house in the past few years, not to exaggerate, but if someone stands in front of any entrance door of my house, chances are there are more than one camera pointing at him/her, plus there are more cameras inside too. That being said, I was still pleasantly surprise by its elegant design when I received this Belkin Netcam. The installation process was fairly easy and simple, less challenging than most of the IP cameras I had installed in the past. Its performance is as good as you would expect from something made by a reputable company such as Belkin. I would give it a 5 star if I wrote this review solely based on what this camera does, but I had to knock off one star based on what it's lack of, which is the capability of Tilt and Pan. A little disappointing, to say the least.One sidenote, among all IP cameras I have tried, I still think the 8910WFoscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with Two-Way Audio and Night Vision (Black) is the best by a long shot in terms of value, performance & functionality.

Reviews.Title: Simple installation and operation, but limited usefulness
Reviews.Author: Jerry Saperstein
Reviews.Content: WiFi cams have been gaining in popularity as ease of use increases, prices come down and quality goes up. This Belkin offering is in the lower-middle of the pack. Installation is simple, if you follow the illustrated instructions. The Android app for remote viewing works well, though Belkin has larded it with silly animations, apparently to disguise the fact that it takes a while to secure a connection to Belkin's servers. For the truly paranoid, this will be a deal breaker. You have to create an account with Belkin (or, more likely, some anonymous vendor Belkin uses), though you provide no personally identifying information such as your real name and address. Some people will be haunted by the fear that someone may be able to spy on them. Image quality on an 802.11g WiFi network is pretty good, though the frame rate is quite low at between 1 and 5 frames per second. Color rendering and resolution are better than average and the audio pickup is excellent. Infrared viewing (so-called "night vision") works well. You can set up the camera to detect motion and email you an alert. It works, though there can be a considerable lag time. There is no provision for real-time recording, though you do get a couple of stills.The Belkin unit does not work with any third-party video surveillance software and is thus useless for real security applications.In short, the Belkin Netcam HD is notable for its ease of installation. It is also easy to use with the Android application or directly from your internet browser. For babycam or similar limited applications for people with limited technical skills (or those who just don't to hassle with installation), this product does the job. But for real surveillance use, this isn't the route to go.Jerry

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Kaio
Reviews.Content: There's a whole slew of new IP "baby" cams out there that claim to be fast and easy to setup, but in reality, are anything but.  I've setup many an IP cam, and there's nothing to it. I can get a Foscam up and running 5 minutes out of the box.  By contrast, hours of tinkering with this Belkin only yielded much frustration, spotty connectivity, and utterly useless capability.To be clear -- this product is terrible.The setup process is bogged down by glitches and hiccups.  And by the time you do get the cam setup -- IF you get it setup -- it has spotty video streams and constant signal disconnects.  I have a Foscam in the garage that gets rock solid WiFi connections, yet this Belkin can't hold a signal even when it's right next to my router that has an 18" WiFi booster antenna on it.  I expected better from Belkin.  The Android app is crap.  Maybe the iPhone version is better, but I have my doubts.  My experience with this cam only resulted in it getting hurled into the bottom of a junk drawer, never to be seen again. Useless.  And it's HD, no less.I know these slender, pristine little white gizmos are much coveted. So if that's the look that suits your fancy, then check out a Foscam FI8909W White.  It works, it's easy to setup, and they're cheap.  And the one time I had an issue with one of my 7 Foscams, the company replaced it promptly with no hassles.  Take note Belkin.Overpriced garbage at best.

Reviews.Content: Recommended by a friend but I was a bit skeptical. I wanted a camera where I could view my garage, home and access areas. Then I can access any of my cameras via my iphone and watch real-time. There is even a speaker so I can communicate with the pet or visitor. It drives my animals crazy when I talk to them over the camera. The camera is so easy to setup. Just remember to create a custom name (not Belkin or Net cam but something very unique). You access it like a wireless point. Sign it up and the whole process takes just a couple of minutes. You can adjust the camera via your smart phone and with your computer. They do not seem to be a duplicate and each method has some benefits. I have turned off the night vision as the red rings does give the camera location away. I do like the ability to check my garage to see if I remembered to close the door. Overall a great purchase with lots of potential.

I am not sure why but you cannot take a picture or record from the website, I would have thought this would have been capable. In my original review, I originally wrote that the picture and video quality were good but after a couple of weeks, the picture quality really is just ok and the video quality is very choppy even though I have cable modem. I think at this point, I would say that the wireless IP camera is still in its beginning stages but if you do need a wireless IP camera, this one is pretty easy to set up but the picture and video quality still has a ways to go.

Reviews.Title: Spying on your house has drawbacks.
Reviews.Author: G. Ware Cornell Jr. "anotherlawyer"
Reviews.Content: Ever since humans started living in enclosures, the desire to know just what goes on inside those structures when away has existed. Now, thanks to the Internet and Droid and iOS apps you can spy on your house from anywhere in the world. There is no telling how many nannies have gotten fired as a result of snooping, but I'd bet it is more than the number of burglars snagged in the act.The problem with these cameras and associated apps is that they are only as good as your WiFi protection. If its hacked so is your security system. So a drive-by burglar can watch you leave for that weekend at the beach and know he has some time to ransack the stuff you didn't take with you.Now the quality if the video image is good. The night vision feature lets you look outside to catch possums, raccoons, and tomcats who venture onto your property, in case your wondering why your pets are on high alert. Because of the nature of the Internet, there is a lag, so it's not exactly realtime, meaning the burglar has already held you at gunpoint before he makes an appearance on your iPhone.In short, if you want professional security cameras, look elsewhere. If you want a toy, this is a good one.
